etymologies: late 15th century: from French poème or Latin poema, from Greek poēma, early variant of poiēma ‘fiction, poem’, from poiein ‘create’

definitions: a piece of writing that partakes of the nature of both speech and song that is nearly always rhythmical, usually metaphorical, and often exhibits such formal elements as meter, rhyme, and stanzaic structure

examples.text: the sun is an important symbol in this poem

shortDefinitions: piece of writing in which expression of feelings and ideas is given intensity by particular attention to diction sometimes involving rhyme

definitions: something that arouses strong emotions because of its beauty

examples.text: you make a poem of riding downhill on your bike

shortDefinitions: something that arouses strong emotions because of its beauty
